headline: Autodesk raises annual forecasts on growing software demand, shares rise
summary: Autodesk raised its annual revenue and profit forecasts on Thursday, betting on growing demand for its design and engineering software, sending its shares surging around 12% in extended trading. Demand for the company's products is steadily increasing across construction, infrastructure and manufacturing industries, driven by growing subscription renewals and expanding enterprise agreements with large customers. Autodesk offers software that enables users to design buildings, infrastructure and products using data-rich 3D models rather than traditional blueprints.

headline: Autodesk Bumps Up Guidance as Sales Jump
summary: The company, which provides AutoCAD and other design software, logged double-digit sales growth in its latest quarter, helped by strong demand for its architecture, engineering, construction and operations software.

headline: Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK) Exceeds Q2 Expectations, Stock Jumps 11.3%
summary: 3D design software company Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK) reported Q2 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 17.1% year on year to $1.76 billion. Guidance for next quarter’s revenue was better than expected at $1.81 billion at the midpoint, 1.9% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.62 per share was 6.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Autodesk: Fiscal Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The San Francisco-based company said it had profit of $1.46 per share. Earnings, adjusted for stock option expense and amortization costs, came to $2.62 per share. The results topped Wall Street expectations.

headline: Autodesk (ADSK) Expands Construction Solutions With New GoFormz Integration
summary: Autodesk (ADSK) recently announced a new integration with GoFormz, enhancing the functionality of its Construction Cloud platform. This development could potentially strengthen Autodesk's position in the construction management space by improving workflow efficiency and data accuracy for construction firms. Despite this positive news, Autodesk's stock price remained relatively flat over the past week, consistent with the overall market trends. As the S&P 500 reached an all-time high, the...
